meanings.definition: The state or condition of being an heir.
meanings.sent1: Her heirship was evident when she inherited the family estate.
meanings.sent2: The heirship of the eldest son was unquestioned in the will.
meanings.sent3: In the kingdom of toys, the teddy bear claimed heirship over all other stuffed animals.
meanings.sent4: The heirship to the throne was a heavy burden to bear.
meanings.sent5: The heirship to the magical amulet granted great power to its possessor.

meanings.definition: The right or status of being an heir.
meanings.sent1: His heirship entitled him to the family fortune.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer explained the intricacies of heirship laws to the siblings.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed its heirship to the house included unlimited treats.
meanings.sent4: She wore the heirship to her grandmother's ring with pride.
meanings.sent5: The heirship to the ancient artifact came with a warning of danger.
